column1: The '''Elven Hymn to [[Varda|Elbereth]]''' is a song which was sung by a [[Wandering Companies|company]] of [[Elves]], led by [[Gildor|Gildor Inglorion]], as they passed through [[the Shire]] in the late [[Third Age]]. It was overheard by [[Frodo Baggins]], [[Samwise Gamgee]] and [[Peregrin Took]]. Although the elves would have been singing in [[Sindarin]], of which Frodo knew only a little, he was still able to interpret the meaning of the song. Its content is similar to ''[[A Elbereth Gilthoniel]]''.

column2: O Queen beyond the Western Seas!

column1: O light to us that wander here

column2: Amid the world of woven trees!
Clear are thy eyes and bright thy breath!

column1: Snow-white! Snow-white! We sing to thee

column2: In a far land beyond the sea.

column1: O Stars that in the Sunless Year

column2: With shining hand by her were sown,

column1: In windy fields now bright and clear

column2: We see your silver blossom blown!
We still remember, we who dwell

column1: In this far land beneath the trees,

column2: Thy starlight on the Western Seas.

column1: * [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]'', "[[Three is Company]]"
